intro: Synaspisma peltatum, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a dense, velvety texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Synaspisma peltatum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
